short_summary: Training for Supporting men with lived experiences of sexual trauma
description: The Department of National Defence has a requirement for the provision of virtual training for personnel employed at the Sexual Misconduct Support and Resource Centre (SMSRC) who are involved in service support delivery to men in the context of sexual misconduct.

### Tender Description
The Department of National Defence seeks to provide virtual training to personnel within the Sexual Misconduct Support and Resource Centre (SMSRC) overseeing service support delivery to individuals experiencing sexual misconduct. The primary goal is to deliver unique considerations when supporting clients who identify as men in the context of sexual misconduct.

### Background Information
The SMSRC offers support services to clients affected by sexual misconduct and their families. The centre seeks specialized training to address the specific needs of men who experienced sexual trauma.

### Tender Requirements
The contractor shall provide virtual training to SMSRC personnel in the context of sexual misconduct support services. Participants in the training will include counsellors, peer support facilitators, and practitioners. The training will focus on developing expertise in supporting men affected by sexual misconduct.
